1.content: Do no evils, and no evils shall lay hold of thee.

2.content: Depart from the unjust, and evils shall depart from thee.

3.content: My son, sow not evils in the furrows of injustice, and thou shalt not reap them sevenfold.

4.content: Seek not of the Lord a preeminence, nor of the king the seat of honour.

5.content: Justify not thyself before God, for he knoweth the heart: and desire not to appear wise before the king.

6.content: Seek not to be made a judge, unless thou have strength enough to extirpate iniquities: lest thou fear the person of the powerful, and lay a stumblingblock for thy integrity.

7.content: Offend not against the multitude of a city, neither cast thyself in upon the people,

8.content: Nor bind sin to sin: for even in one thou shalt not be unpunished.

9.content: Be not fainthearted in thy mind:

10.content: Neglect not to pray, and to give alms.

11.content: Say not: God will have respect to the multitude of my gifts, and when I offer to the most high God, he will accept my offerings.

12.content: Laugh no man to scorn in the bitterness of his soul: for there is one that humbleth and exalteth, God who seeth all.

13.content: Devise not a lie against thy brother: neither do the like against thy friend.

14.content: Be not willing to make any manner of lie: for the custom thereof is not good.

15.content: Be not full of words in a multitude of ancients, and repeat not the word in thy prayer.

16.content: Hate not laborious works, nor husbandry ordained by the most High.

17.content: Number not thyself among the multitude of the disorderly.

18.content: Remember wrath, for it will not tarry long.

19.content: Humble thy spirit very much: for the vengeance on the flesh of the ungodly is fire and worms.

20.content: Do not transgress against thy friend deferring money, nor despise thy dear brother for the sake of gold.

21.content: Depart not from a wise and good wife, whom thou hast gotten in the fear of the Lord: for the grace of her modesty is above gold.

22.content: Hurt not the servant that worketh faithfully, nor the hired man that giveth thee his life.

23.content: Let a wise servant be dear to thee as thy own soul, defraud him not of liberty, nor leave him needy.

24.content: Hast thou cattle? have an eye to them: and if they be for thy profit, keep them with thee.

25.content: Hast thou children? instruct them, and bow down their neck from their childhood.

26.content: Hast thou daughters? have a care of their body, and shew not thy countenance gay towards them.

27.content: Marry thy daughter well, and thou shalt do a great work, and give her to a wise man.

28.content: If thou hast a wife according to thy soul, cast her not off: and to her that is hateful, trust not thyself. With thy whole heart,

29.content: Honour thy father, and forget not the groanings of thy mother:

30.content: Remember that thou hadst not been born but through them: and make a return to them as they have done for thee.

31.content: With all thy soul fear the Lord, and reverence his priests.

32.content: With all thy strength love him that made thee: and forsake not his ministers.

33.content: Honour God with all thy soul and give honour to the priests, and purify thyself with thy arms.

34.content: Give them their portion, as it is commanded thee, of the firstfruits and of purifications: and for thy negligences purify thyself with a few.

35.content: Offer to the Lord the gift of thy shoulders, and the sacrifice of sanctification, and the firstfruits of the holy things:

36.content: And stretch out thy hand to the poor, that thy expiation and thy blessing may be perfected.

37.content: A gift hath grace in the sight of all the living, and restrain not grace from the dead.

38.content: Be not wanting in comforting them that weep, and walk with them that mourn.

39.content: Be not slow to visit the sick: for by these things thou shalt be confirmed in love.

40.content: In all thy works remember thy last end, and thou shalt never sin.

disclaimer: This book is an addition to the Old Testament. It is not found in the Hebrew or Aramaic texts, but are found in the Greek Septuagint and the Latin Vulgate.
